title: MSI GE62 Apache Pro freezing issue is back
body:
Greetings, I made a post a few months ago about my laptop freezing and I was able to fix it by turning off the xbox game dvr. However, the freezing started happening again in 3 games in 3 days. My game would freeze at exactly the 19:31 mark and I'm forced to hold the power button and restart my laptop. I've tried all the solutions in the FPS guide but my FPS doesn't seem to be a problem since my game froze just now. Like I stated in my previous post, I'm not a tech-savvy person so I need help with fixing this. The video I posted isn't mine, but the video is the same video I linked in my previous post from a few months ago. I hope that I can get a solution ASAP before the season starts. 

Link to previous post:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/JF2NIzdi-issue-regarding-msi-ge62-2qd-apache-pro

replies.body: I think I was able to resolve it by changing to compatibility of my client from Windows 10 back to Windows 7
Did you ensure the Game DVR feature is still disabled? Some recent Windows updates has re-enabled this feature for some players.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=rAkT5E24,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-12-05T00:36:28.647+0000)
>
> Did you ensure the Game DVR feature is still disabled? Some recent Windows updates has re-enabled this feature for some players.

Yes, I've already checked and it's off. I've already sent in a support ticket in case.

Gotcha. Thanks for submitting a ticket, we'll definitely need to take a look at your system logs to determine what's causing this again. One of our tech specialists will get back to you soon.

Let me know if you have any questions.
